title: People are furious that Game Of Thrones didn't win many awards at the Emmys
text:
From Cosmopolitan

Game Of Thrones missed out on a bunch of awards at the Emmys last night.

Fans are gutted that the final series didn't win as big as they'd hoped.

Game Of Thrones may have won the award for Outstanding Drama Series at the Emmys last night... but it missed out on plenty of the 32 it was nominated for.

Fans of the show, which ended for good in May this year, were hoping it would win big at its last hurrah. But alas, it wasn't meant to be, and despite winning the big award, the only other they scooped was for Peter Dinklage, who won the Supporting Actor award. Not to worry though - the show already won 10 Creative Arts Emmys last week.

Of course, loyal followers were pretty gutted that they'll never have the opportunity to win an Emmy again.

emilia played one of the strongest characters of game of thrones, she deserved that award. #Emmys



"we will come again, queen, and the next time we shall come with fire and blood." pic.twitter.com/UyLOSckgYY



— alan (@alanbibriesca) September 23, 2019

at the end of the day, no award can decide whether someone is an outstanding actress/actor or not. we’re still & always will be proud of you, emilia clarke. thank you for bringing life to one of the most phenomenal characters ever made.#Emmys #GameOfThrones pic.twitter.com/vSkFf6j5Rs — nightwing’s left ass cheek (@GREEKHEROINES) September 23, 2019

None of the Game of Thrones women won an award.. that’s so sad, it’s not their fault the script sucked, they killed it.. oh well #Emmys pic.twitter.com/dGbBz0lBBu — L*v (@nothinmatters13) September 23, 2019

you’re telling me alfie allen, best male actor in game of thrones, didn’t win a single award for his performance as theon greyjoy? NOT ONE?

pic.twitter.com/uryK9KgB88

— abbey loves alannys (@theonsmedici) September 23, 2019

alfie allen and lena headey knowing they’re the best actors in game of thrones yet never once got an award for it

pic.twitter.com/ZQxuBHDZM5

— abbey loves alannys (@theonsmedici) September 23, 2019

But - silver linings - we did manage to see all the cast together on stage one last time (um, apart from Bran Stark, that is).

Photo credit: ROBYN BECK - Getty Images More

Emilia Clarke losing out on the Best Actress award appears to be what's upsetting most fans, but at least they can rest knowing she lost out to the brilliant Jodie Comer in Killing Eve.

Supporting Actress nominees Sophie Turner, Maisie Williams, Gwendoline Christie and Lena Headey lost to Julia Garner from Ozark, while Supporting Actor nominees Alfie Allen and Nikolaj Coster-Waldau lost to their very own Peter Dinklage.

Brb, just off to cry about GoT really being over.

Follow Abbi on Instagram.
